verb.description: Provoke or intensify (strong feelings, especially anger) in someone.
examples: high fines further inflamed public feelings

verb.description: Cause inflammation in (a part of the body)
examples: the finger joints were inflamed with rheumatoid arthritis

verb.description: Light up with or as if with flames.
examples: the torches inflame the night to the eastward

origin: Middle English enflaume, inflaume, from Old French enflammer, from Latin inflammare, from in- into + flamma flame.
